title: How to Make Moroccan Chicken Casserole

steps.headline:

steps.description: Preheat your oven to 392 degrees F, 200 degrees C, or gas mark 6.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0e\/Chicken3_642.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0e\/Chicken3_642.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":567.4666666666667,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Marinate the chicken in the olive oil. Use a dash of salt and pepper for seasoning.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/3b\/Chicken4_992.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/3b\/Chicken4_992.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Boil the potatoes in a pot with water. Cook the potatoes for 3 minutes, remove the pot from the heat, drain the water out, and place the potatoes on the side for now.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/a6\/Chicken5_626.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/a6\/Chicken5_626.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":342,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":564.9333333333333,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-moroccan-chicken-casserole<\/a> shared with permission\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil to a frying pan and start heating it up. Place the chicken pieces into the frying pan with the skin against the pan.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/4f\/Chicken6_521.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/4f\/Chicken6_521.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":342,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":564.9333333333333,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-moroccan-chicken-casserole<\/a> shared with permission\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Add the shallots and garlic to the frying pan. Brown the potatoes in a separate pan and cook until everything is lightly browned.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/cb\/Chicken7_666.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/cb\/Chicken7_666.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":339,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":559.8666666666667,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Boil the lemon zest in water for 3 minutes

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7d\/Chicken8_957.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7d\/Chicken8_957.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":340,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":562.4,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-moroccan-chicken-casserole<\/a> shared with permission\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Pour all of the ingredients, except the parsley, into a large bowl. Properly wash your hands and mix everything together.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/2a\/Chicken9_840.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/2a\/Chicken9_840.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":340,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":562.4,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-moroccan-chicken-casserole<\/a> shared with permission\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Pour the mixture into a casserole dish and place the dish into the oven for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Use a baster to spread the juices around the casserole and on the top.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven and serve with parsley.
